info.title: Partner Referrals
info.description:
The Partner Referrals API enables a marketplace to add PayPal seller accounts. It supports the Connected Path marketplace models.
Important: PayPal for Marketplaces is a limited-release solution at this time. It is available to select partners for approved use cases. For more information, reach out to your PayPal account manager.
In the Connected Path, you host a button on your website that takes sellers to PayPal to create and configure a PayPal account. The Onboarding API enables you to collect seller data and pass it to the account creation and setup forms, reducing the burden on sellers during the signup and setup process. Call the create partner referral and show referral data methods for the Connected Path.

post.description: Creates a partner referral that is shared by the API caller. The referrals contains the client's personal, business, financial and operations that the partner wants to onboard the client.

201.description: A successful request returns the HTTP `201 Created` status code and a JSON response body that contains a [HATEOAS link](/docs/api/overview/#hateoas-links) to show the referral data and an `action_url` to which you redirect the customer in a browser to complete the signup process. The `partner_referral_id` token is appended to the URL.

400.description: Request is not well-formed, syntactically incorrect, or violates schema.

401.description: The API call is not authorized.

403.description: Authorization failed due to insufficient permissions or missing scopes on the caller Account.

422.description: The caller is not a business account or the account is closed or locked.

500.description: An internal server error has occurred.

get.description: Shows details for referral data, by ID, that was shared by the API caller.

200.description: A successful request returns the HTTP `200 OK` status code and a JSON response body that shows referral data.

401.description: The API call is not authorized.

403.description: Authorization failed due to insufficient permissions or missing scopes on the caller Account.

500.description: An internal server error has occurred.

tags.name: partner-referrals
tags.description: Enables you to create and get information about shared customer data.

scopes.https://uri.paypal.com/services/customer: Manage external referral data with PayPal
Manage referral data shared by Partner with PayPal. To be used by only internal apps

partner_referral_id.name: partner_referral_id
partner_referral_id.description: The ID of the partner-referrals data for which to show details.

enum: the value of a field is either too short or too long
the value of a field does not conform to the expected format
the value of a field is invalid
the number of items in an array parameter is too small or too large
This API call is not authorized
You do not have permission to access or perform operations on this resource.
Account for this Partner ID does not exist.
Account has not been configured to use PayPal Complete Payments

error_details.title: Error Details
error_details.description: The error details. Required for client-side `4XX` errors.

field.description: The field that caused the error. If this field is in the body, set this value to the field's JSON pointer value. Required for client-side errors.

value.description: The value of the field that caused the error.

location.description: The location of the field that caused the error. Value is `body`, `path`, or `query`.

issue.description: The unique, fine-grained application-level error code.

description.description: The human-readable description for an issue. The description can change over the lifetime of an API, so clients must not depend on this value.

enum: Request is not well-formed, syntactically incorrect, or violates schema.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

information_link.description: The information link, or URI, that shows detailed information about this error for the developer.

enum: Authentication failed due to missing authorization header, or invalid authentication credentials.

prefix.description: The prefix, or title, to the party's name.

given_name.description: When the party is a person, the party's given, or first, name.

surname.description: When the party is a person, the party's surname or family name. Also known as the last name. Required when the party is a person. Use also to store multiple surnames including the matronymic, or mother's, surname.

middle_name.description: When the party is a person, the party's middle name. Use also to store multiple middle names including the patronymic, or father's, middle name.

suffix.description: The suffix for the party's name.

full_name.description: When the party is a person, the party's full name.

type.description: The type of name. Currently supported values are: `LEGAL`.

country_code.description:
The [two-character ISO 3166-1 code](/docs/api/reference/country-codes/) that identifies the country or region.
Note: The country code for Great Britain is GB and not UK as used in the top-level domain names for that country. Use the `C2` country code for China worldwide for comparable uncontrolled price (CUP) method, bank card, and cross-border transactions.

address_portable.title: Portable Postal Address (Medium-Grained)
address_portable.description: The portable international postal address. Maps to [AddressValidationMetadata](https://github.com/googlei18n/libaddressinput/wiki/AddressValidationMetadata) and HTML 5.1 [Autofilling form controls: the autocomplete attribute](https://www.w3.org/TR/html51/sec-forms.html#autofilling-form-controls-the-autocomplete-attribute).

address_line_1.description: The first line of the address. For example, number or street. For example, `173 Drury Lane`. Required for data entry and compliance and risk checks. Must contain the full address.

address_line_2.description: The second line of the address. For example, suite or apartment number.

address_line_3.description: The third line of the address, if needed. For example, a street complement for Brazil, direction text, such as `next to Walmart`, or a landmark in an Indian address.

admin_area_4.description:
The neighborhood, ward, or district. Smaller than `admin_area_level_3` or `sub_locality`. Value is:
  • The postal sorting code for Guernsey and many French territories, such as French Guiana.
  • The fine-grained administrative levels in China.

admin_area_3.description:
A sub-locality, suburb, neighborhood, or district. Smaller than `admin_area_level_2`. Value is:
  • Brazil. Suburb, bairro, or neighborhood.
  • India. Sub-locality or district. Street name information is not always available but a sub-locality or district can be a very small area.

admin_area_2.description: A city, town, or village. Smaller than `admin_area_level_1`.

admin_area_1.description:
The highest level sub-division in a country, which is usually a province, state, or ISO-3166-2 subdivision. Format for postal delivery. For example, `CA` and not `California`. Value, by country, is:
  • UK. A county.
  • US. A state.
  • Canada. A province.
  • Japan. A prefecture.
  • Switzerland. A kanton.

postal_code.description: The postal code, which is the zip code or equivalent. Typically required for countries with a postal code or an equivalent. See [postal code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Postal_code).

address_details.title: Address Details
address_details.description:
The non-portable additional address details that are sometimes needed for compliance, risk, or other scenarios where fine-grain address information might be needed. Not portable with common third party and open source. Redundant with core fields.
For example, `address_portable.address_line_1` is usually a combination of `address_details.street_number`, `street_name`, and `street_type`.

street_name.description: The street name. Just `Drury` in `Drury Lane`.

street_type.description: The street type. For example, avenue, boulevard, road, or expressway.

delivery_service.description: The delivery service. Post office box, bag number, or post office name.

building_name.description: A named locations that represents the premise. Usually a building name or number or collection of buildings with a common name or number. For example, Craven House.

sub_building.description: The first-order entity below a named building or location that represents the sub-premise. Usually a single building within a collection of buildings with a common name. Can be a flat, story, floor, room, or apartment.

person_address_type.description: The address type under which the provided address is tagged.
person_address_type.title: Person address type

person_address_detail.title: Person address detail
person_address_detail.description: A simple postal address with coarse-grained fields.

type.description: The address type under which this is classified.

primary.description: Whether this is the primary address of the user. This cannot be directly set to `false`, but rather it is toggled `false` in the datastore when another address is set to primary.

inactive.description: Whether this address has been inactivated.

phone.title: Phone
phone.description: The phone number in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en).

country_code.description: The country calling code (CC), in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). The combined length of the CC and the national number must not be greater than 15 digits. The national number consists of a national destination code (NDC) and subscriber number (SN).

national_number.description: The national number, in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). The combined length of the country calling code (CC) and the national number must not be greater than 15 digits. The national number consists of a national destination code (NDC) and subscriber number (SN).

phone_number_tag.description: Tag associated with the phone number.
phone_number_tag.title: Phone number tag

person_phone_detail.title: Phone details
person_phone_detail.description: The phone number, in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en).

contact_name.description: The name that the phone number is connected to.

inactive.description: Whether this phone number has been inactivated by the user.

primary.description: Whether this is the primary contact phone number of the user.

primary_mobile.description: Whether this is the primary mobile phone number of the user.

tags.description: Array of tags for this phone number.

date_no_time.description: The stand-alone date, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6). To represent special legal values, such as a date of birth, you should use dates with no associated time or time-zone data. Whenever possible, use the standard `date_time` type. This regular expression does not validate all dates. For example, February 31 is valid and nothing is known about leap years.

birth_details.title: Birth details
birth_details.description: Date of birth data provided by the user

date_of_birth.description: date of birth, fomrat [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

date_time.description:
The date and time, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6). Seconds are required while fractional seconds are optional.
Note: The regular expression provides guidance but does not reject all invalid dates.

file_reference.title: File Reference
file_reference.description: The file reference. Can be a file in PayPal MediaServ, PayPal DMS, or another custom store.

id.description: The ID of the referenced file.

reference_url.description: The reference URL for the file.

content_type.description: The [Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) media type of the file](https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml).

create_time.description: The date and time when the file was created, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

size.description: The size of the file, in bytes.

href.description: The complete target URL. To make the related call, combine the method with this [URI Template-formatted](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6570) link. For pre-processing, include the `$`, `(`, and `)` characters. The `href` is the key HATEOAS component that links a completed call with a subsequent call.

rel.description: The [link relation type](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5988#section-4), which serves as an ID for a link that unambiguously describes the semantics of the link. See [Link Relations](https://www.iana.org/assignments/link-relations/link-relations.xhtml).

method.description: The HTTP method required to make the related call.

id.description: The encrypted identifier for the document.

labels.description: The document labels. A document could be classfied to multiple categories. For example, a bill document can be classfified as `BILL DOCUMENT` and `UTILITY DOCUMENT`.

identification_number.description: The number for the document. It is the ID number if the document is `ID CARD`, the passport number if the document is `PASSPORT`, etc.

issue_date.description: The issue date of the document.

expiry_date.description: The expire data of the document.

issuing_country_code.description: The country code of the document.

files.description: The files contained in the document. For example, a document could be represented by a front page file and a back page file, etc.

person_document.title: Person document
person_document.description: The documents associated with the person.

type.description: The actual type of the document. It could be `ID_CARD`, `PASSPORT`, etc.

person.title: Person
person.description: Details of the person or party.

citizenship.description: The citizenship country code of the person.

addresses.description: The list of addresses associated with the person.

phones.description: The list of phone numbers associated with the person.

documents.description:
A person's or party's related document data collected from the customer. For example SSN, ITIN, or business registration number collected from the user.
Note: This field is not applicable for POST [/v2/customer/partner-referrals](/docs/api/partner-referrals/v2/#partner-referrals_create) API calls.

individual_owner_type.description: Role of the person party played in the account.
individual_owner_type.title: Individual owner role type

individual_owner.title: Individual_owner
individual_owner.description: The individual owner of the account.

type.description: The actual role of this user on the account, PRIMARY/SECONDARY.

business_sub_type.description: Sub classification of the business type
business_sub_type.title: The business sub type.

business_type_info.title: Business type information
business_type_info.description: The type and subtype of the business.

type.description: Type of business entity like corporation, sole prop, governmental.

subtype.description: The sub classification of the business type.

business_industry.title: Business industry
business_industry.description: The category, subcategory and MCC code of the business.

category.description: The customer's business category code. PayPal uses industry standard seller category codes.

mcc_code.description: The customer's business seller category code. PayPal uses industry standard seller category codes.

subcategory.description: The customer's business subcategory code. PayPal uses industry standard seller subcategory codes.

business_name.title: Business Name
business_name.description: The business name of the party.
Required. The business name of the party.

id.description: The encrypted ID for the business name.

type.description: The type of business name. For example, trading name.

email_address.description:
The internationalized email address.
Note: Up to 64 characters are allowed before and 255 characters are allowed after the @ sign. However, the generally accepted maximum length for an email address is 254 characters. The pattern verifies that an unquoted @ sign exists.

email.title: Email of a person orbusiness
email.description: An email address at which the person or business can be contacted.

type.description: The role of the email address.

business_address_type.description: Address type under which the provided address is tagged
business_address_type.title: Business address type

business_address_detail.title: Business_address_detail
business_address_detail.description: A simple postal address with coarse-grained fields.

type.description: The address type under which this is classified. For example, shipping or dropoff.

primary.description: Whether this is the primary address of the user. This cannot be directly set to `false`, but rather it is toggled `false` in the datastore when another address is set to primary.

inactive.description: Whether this address has been inactivated.

business_phone_type.title: Phone type
business_phone_type.description: The type of phone number provided. For example, home, work, or mobile.

business_phone_detail.title: Phone details
business_phone_detail.description: The phone number, in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en).

contact_name.description: The name that the phone number is connected to.

inactive.description: Whether this phone number has been inactivated by the user.

primary.description: Whether this is the primary contact phone number of the user.

type.description: The type of phone number provided. For example, home, work, or mobile.

tags.description: Array of tags for this phone number.

business_document.title: Business document
business_document.description: The documents associated with the business.

type.description: The actual type of the document.

business_type.description: Information related to the business like the nature of business, started date etc.

business_industry.description: Information related to the business like the nature of business, started date etc.

business_incorporation.description: Information related to the business like the nature of business, started date etc.

addresses.description: List of addresses associated with the business entity.

phones.description: List of phone number associated with the business.

documents.description: Business Party related Document data collected from the customer.. For example SSN, ITIN, Business registration number that were collected from the user.

percentage.description: The percentage, as a fixed-point, signed decimal number. For example, define a 19.99% interest rate as `19.99`.

individual_beneficial_owner.title: Individual_beneficial_owner
individual_beneficial_owner.description: The individual owner of the account.

percentage_of_ownership.description: The percentage of shares this person owns in the company.

business_beneficial_owner.title: Business_beneficial_owner
business_beneficial_owner.description: The business beneficial owner of the account.

percentage_of_ownership.description: The percentage of shares this person owns in the company.

office_bearer_role.description: Role of the person party played in the business.
office_bearer_role.title: Role type

office_bearer.title: Office Bearers
office_bearer.description: The office bearer associated to the account.

role.description: The role of the office bearer in the company.

currency_code.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

money.title: Money
money.description: The currency and amount for a financial transaction, such as a balance or payment due.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

currency_range.title: Currency Range
currency_range.description: The currency range, from the minimum inclusive amount to the maximum inclusive amount.

minimum_amount.description: The minimum inclusive amount for the range.

maximum_amount.description: The maximum inclusive amount for the range.

purpose_code_enum.title: Purpose Code
purpose_code_enum.description:
The purpose code. Required only for India. For more information, see the Reserve Bank Of India web site. Value is:
  • P0104. Cross border delivery of goods and services.
  • P0301. Business related travel purchase.
  • P0801. Hardware consulting.
  • P0802. Software consulting.
  • P0803. Data processing consulting.
  • P0805. Freelance journalism.
  • P0806. Other information services.
  • P0902. Licensing revenues.
  • P1004. Legal.
  • P1005. Accounting and tax.
  • P1006. Business and management consultancy.
  • P1007. Advertising and market research.
  • P1008. Research and development.
  • P1009. Architectural services.

business_entity.title: Business_entity
business_entity.description: The business entity of the account.

beneficial_owners.description: List of beneficial owners part of the entity. They can be either a Person or a business entity.

office_bearers.description: List of Directors present as part of the business entity.

annual_sales_volume_range.description: The range for the total annual sales volume of the business.

average_monthly_volume_range.description: The range for the average monthly volume of the business.

business_description.description: The business goals description. For example, a mission statement.

account.title: Account
account.description: Common account object to hold the account related details of the customer.

individual_owners.description: List of owners in the account. There should be only one primary account owner which is mentioned in their role_type.

language.description: The [language tag](https://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47#section-2) for the language in which to localize the error-related strings, such as messages, issues, and suggested actions. The tag is made up of the [ISO 639-2 language code](https://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/php/code_list.php), the optional [ISO-15924 script tag](https://www.unicode.org/iso15924/codelists.html), and the [ISO-3166 alpha-2 country code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/country-codes/).

partner_config_override.title: Partner Configuration Override
partner_config_override.description: The preference to customize the web experience of the customer by overriding that is set at the Partner's Account.

partner_logo_url.description: The partner logo URL to display in the customer's onboarding flow.

return_url.description: The URL to which to redirect the customer upon completion of the onboarding process.

return_url_description.description: The description of the return URL.

action_renewal_url.description: If `renew_action_url` expires, redirect the customer to this URL.

show_add_credit_card.description: Indicates whether to show an add credit card page.

identifier.title: Bank Account Identifier
identifier.description: The bank account ID. An ID with `ROUTING_NUMBER_1` is required.

country_code-2.description:
The [two-character ISO 3166-1 code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/country-codes/) that identifies the country or region.
Note: The country code for Great Britain is GB and not UK as used in the top-level domain names for that country. Use the `C2` country code for China worldwide for comparable uncontrolled price (CUP) method, bank card, and cross-border transactions.

address_portable-2.title: Portable Postal Address (Medium-Grained)
address_portable-2.description: The portable international postal address. Maps to [AddressValidationMetadata](https://github.com/googlei18n/libaddressinput/wiki/AddressValidationMetadata) and HTML 5.1 [Autofilling form controls: the autocomplete attribute](https://www.w3.org/TR/html51/sec-forms.html#autofilling-form-controls-the-autocomplete-attribute).

address_line_1.description: The first line of the address. For example, number or street. For example, `173 Drury Lane`. Required for data entry and compliance and risk checks. Must contain the full address.

address_line_2.description: The second line of the address. For example, suite or apartment number.

address_line_3.description: The third line of the address, if needed. For example, a street complement for Brazil, direction text, such as `next to Walmart`, or a landmark in an Indian address.

admin_area_4.description:
The neighborhood, ward, or district. Smaller than `admin_area_level_3` or `sub_locality`. Value is:
  • The postal sorting code for Guernsey and many French territories, such as French Guiana.
  • The fine-grained administrative levels in China.

admin_area_3.description:
A sub-locality, suburb, neighborhood, or district. Smaller than `admin_area_level_2`. Value is:
  • Brazil. Suburb, bairro, or neighborhood.
  • India. Sub-locality or district. Street name information is not always available but a sub-locality or district can be a very small area.

admin_area_2.description: A city, town, or village. Smaller than `admin_area_level_1`.

admin_area_1.description:
The highest level sub-division in a country, which is usually a province, state, or ISO-3166-2 subdivision. Format for postal delivery. For example, `CA` and not `California`. Value, by country, is:
  • UK. A county.
  • US. A state.
  • Canada. A province.
  • Japan. A prefecture.
  • Switzerland. A kanton.

postal_code.description: The postal code, which is the zip code or equivalent. Typically required for countries with a postal code or an equivalent. See [postal code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Postal_code).

address_details.title: Address Details
address_details.description:
The non-portable additional address details that are sometimes needed for compliance, risk, or other scenarios where fine-grain address information might be needed. Not portable with common third party and open source. Redundant with core fields.
For example, `address_portable.address_line_1` is usually a combination of `address_details.street_number`, `street_name`, and `street_type`.

street_name.description: The street name. Just `Drury` in `Drury Lane`.

street_type.description: The street type. For example, avenue, boulevard, road, or expressway.

delivery_service.description: The delivery service. Post office box, bag number, or post office name.

building_name.description: A named locations that represents the premise. Usually a building name or number or collection of buildings with a common name or number. For example, Craven House.

sub_building.description: The first-order entity below a named building or location that represents the sub-premise. Usually a single building within a collection of buildings with a common name. Can be a flat, story, floor, room, or apartment.

mandate.title: Mandate
mandate.description: Sellers consent to operate on this financial instrument.

accepted.description: Whether mandate was accepted or not.

nick_name.description: The user-provided short name for the user's bank account.

currency_code.description: The primary currency code of the bank account.

identifiers.description:
An array of instrument institute attributes. Used with the account number to uniquely identify the instrument. Value is:
  • For banks with IBAN information, the IBAN number.
  • For banks with BBAN information, the BBAN number.
  • For banks with both IBAN and BBAN information, the IBAN number.

financial_instruments.title: Financial instrument.
financial_instruments.description: Financial instruments attached to this account.

banks.description: An array of banks attached to this managed account.

classic_api_integration.title: CLASSIC API integration
classic_api_integration.description: The integration details for PayPal CLASSIC endpoints.

rest_api_integration.title: REST API Integration
rest_api_integration.description: The integration details for PayPal REST endpoints.

integration_type.title: Integration Type
integration_type.description: The type of REST-endpoint integration. To integrate with Braintree v.zero for PayPal REST endpoints, specify `third_party_details`.

first_party_details.title: REST First-Party Details
first_party_details.description: The integration details for PayPal first party REST endpoints.

features.description: An array of features that partner can access, or use, in PayPal on behalf of the seller. The seller grants permission for these features to the partner.

seller_nonce.description: S256 - The code verifier must be high-entropy cryptographic random string with a byte length of 43-128 range.

third_party_details.title: REST Third-Party Details
third_party_details.description: The integration details for PayPal REST endpoints.

features.description: An array of features that partner can access, or use, in PayPal on behalf of the seller. The seller grants permission for these features to the partner.

integration_details.title: Integration Details
integration_details.description: The integration details for the partner and customer relationship. Required if `operation` is `API_INTEGRATION`.

billing_experience_preference.title: Billing Experience Preference
billing_experience_preference.description: The preference that customizes the billing experience of the customer.

experience_id.description: The ID of the payment web experience profile.

billing_context_set.description: Indicates whether the partner has already displayed the billing context to the seller.

billing_agreement.title: Billing Agreement
billing_agreement.description: The details of the billing agreement between the partner and a seller.

merchant_custom_data.description: The custom data for the billing agreement.

approval_url.description: The URL to which to redirect seller to accept the billing agreement.

ec_token.description: The billing agreement token for the agreement.

operation.title: Operation
operation.description: The required operation to share data.

The operation to enable for the customer. To enable the collection of the API permissions that you require to integrate with the customer, specify `API_INTEGRATION`. `BANK_ADDITION` is supported only for the US.

product.description: The PayPal product for which the customer is onboarded.
product.title: Product Name

capabilities.description: Optional capabilities of the selected PayPal product for which the customer is being onboarded.
capabilities.title: Capability

type.description: The type of consent. `SHARE_DATA_CONSENT` gives consent to you to share your customer's data with PayPal.

granted.description: Indicates whether the customer agreed to share this type of data. To give consent, specify `true`. To withhold consent, specify `false`.

currency_code-2.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/api/reference/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

transfer_method.title: Requested transfer method and currency for a country
transfer_method.description: Requested transfer method and currency for a country.

currencies.description: Requested Currencies for a Transfer Method.

country_transfer_method_currency_selecti.title: Requested country, transfer method and currency
country_transfer_method_currency_selecti.description: Requested country, transfer method and currency.

transfer_methods.description: Requested transfer method and currency for a country.

marketplace.description: If `true`, specifies that the merchant or platform is offering goods or services on behalf of 3rd party sellers.

kyc_required.description: If `true`, specifies that the Kyc is required for the merchant.

country_transfer_method_currency_selecti.description: Requested country, transfer method and currency.

referral_data.title: Customer Data
referral_data.description: The customer's referral data that partners share with PayPal.

allOf.description: The common account model representing the basic account structure.

email.description: Email address of the customer used to create the account.

preferred_language_code.description: The preferred [locale code](/docs/api/reference/locale-codes/) to use in the onboarding flow for the customer.

tracking_id.description: The partner's unique identifier for this customer in their system which can be used to track user in PayPal.

partner_config_override.description: The configuration property that the partner intends to override for this onboarding request.

financial_instruments.description: Array of financial instruments attached to the customer's account.

operations.description: An array of operations to perform for the customer while they share their data.

products.description: An array of PayPal products to which the partner wants to onboard the customer.

capabilities.description: An array of capabilities which the partner wants to enable for the selected products. Supported only when products are specified.

legal_consents.description: An array of all consents that the partner has received from this seller. If `SHARE_DATA_CONSENT` is not granted, PayPal does not store customer data.

partner_referral_id.description: The ID to access the customer's data shared by the partner with PayPal.

submitter_payer_id.description: The payer ID of the partner who shared the referral data.

partner_config_override.return_url_description: the url to return the merchant after the paypal onboarding process.
